title: NRL star Manase Fainu is charged over a brawl at a church dance after man is stabbed
text:
Manly Sea Eagles star Manase Fainu has been charged over a church dance brawl that ended in a man being stabbed.

The 21-year-old handed himself over to officers at Liverpool Police Station in Sydney's west on Tuesday, flanked by his manager Mario Tartak and high-profile lawyer Elias Tabchouri.

The brawl broke out at a church function in Liverpool, in Sydney's west, on Friday night.

Police allege Fainu was involved in the scuffle before taking out a knife and stabbing another man.

Manly Sea Eagles star Manase Fainu (left) turned himself into Liverpool Police Station on Tuesday morning

Police allege Fainu (far left) was involved in the scuffle before taking out a knife and stabbing another man.

The NRL star was charged with wound person with intent to cause grievous bodily harm, affray and recklessly cause grievous bodily harm in company, on Tuesday.

He was refused bail and will appear in court later this afternoon.

'Manly Warringah Sea Eagles are aware of an incident involving Manase Fainu over the weekend,' the NRL club said in a statement.

'The club has spoken to his management and have informed the NRL integrity unit. The club is monitoring the situation pending further investigation.'

The Sea Eagles hooker's arm was in a sling from an on-field shoulder injury at the time of the incident.

Fainu tried to speak with police over the weekend, but officers weren't available on the day.

The Sea Eagles passed information about the incident onto the NRL integrity unit on Monday, but there is a belief Fainu has little to worry about.

Fainu is highly rated by coach Des Hasler and those at Manly.

He will be the club's first-choice No.9 in 2020, after Hasler released Apisai Koroisau from his contract to allow Fainu's progression.

Dangerous out of dummy-half, Fainu has formed a key part of Manly's attack through the middle with Tom Trbojevic and Daly Cherry-Evans.

He was, however, banned from the opening round of the 2019 season by the NRL, after pleading guilty last September to recording a sex act without consent.

No conviction was recorded in court for that matter, after a magistrate took into account that Fainu had immediately deleted the recording, and other factors.
description: Manly Sea Eagles star Manase Fainu has been charged over a church dance brawl that resulted in a man being stabbed.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
